1741C35D86C04C829D68D1E078F165AB.description:
Label a partitioned shape (e.g., one whole rectangle was separated into 2 halves, one
whole circle was separated into three thirds).

5ED0473DFC2F4E96A0EDB50D94B478FC.description: Partition circles and rectangles into 2 and 4 equal parts.

F0682D48C14640288D4D73DEA860CD3A.description:
Partition circles and rectangles into two, three, or four equal shares, describe the shares using the words halves,
thirds, fourths, half of, third of, fourth of, and describe the whole as two halves, three thirds, or four fourths.
Recognize that equal shares of identical wholes need not have the same shape.

A54C067C028A446EB8686FBF03E66BA5.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

B38E0783948A49B1A4E1E755E8C61F14.description:
Partition a rectangle into rows and columns of same-size rectangles and count to find the total number of
rectangles.

B96B19BA0F324BA5BFED87F21594187C.description: Draw two- dimensional shapes with specific attributes.

D9F6C80066C943DBA7E193773EE7E196.description:
Distinguish two- or three- dimensional shapes based upon their attributes (i.e., #of sides,
equal or different lengths of sides, # of faces, # of corners).

E15AE39A37974BD1BB781553C09AD383.description:
Identify two- dimensional shapes such as rhombus, pentagons, hexagons, octagon, ovals,
equilateral, isosceles, and scalene triangles.

A71A51E8C53F4BF983836135ABBA0369.description:
Identify and describe specified attributes of two-dimensional and three-dimensional shapes, according to the
number and shape of faces, number of angles, and the number of sides and/or vertices. Draw two-dimensional
shapes based on the specified attributes (e.g., triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, and hexagons).

5EC5CE5816AC410DB26B39DAAEA3FF4E.description:
Reason with shapes and
their attributes.

1EED287A493D460CB7A65E4B3EB33EA4.description:
Compare the information shown in a bar graph or picture graph with up to 4 categories.
Solve simple comparisons of how many more or how many less.

E9EA8C2A6447432EBF3EB96DB6D5EB65.description: Organize data by representing categorical data on a pictorial graph or bar graph.

0154D59E58144B3692037C05FC5E3116.description: Analyze data by sorting into categories established by each question

97221548567A4F33962A57BEA5C3FC7D.description:
Identify the value of each category represented on picture graph and bar graph or each
point on a line plot.

8AFE13E75E214573A5BA7D7F899121AF.description:
Draw a picture graph and a bar graph (with single-unit scale) to represent a data set with up to four categories.
Solve simple put-together, take-apart, and compare problems using information presented in the graph. See
Table 1.

A8446EF78BE844F68B5BAE21F1F3A4C1.description: Organize data by representing continuous data on a line plot.

D96060D188E542DFBB4AB63BBDA9A0F3.description:
Generate measurement data by measuring lengths of several objects to the nearest whole unit, or by making
repeated measurements of the same object. Show the measurements by making a line plot, where the horizontal
scale is marked off in whole-number units.

30275D1634734D6E92A9F0EEB7BF9A15.description: Solve word problems using dollar bills, quarters, dimes, nickels or pennies.

274D6AC1808340118D5FB0E971022F8B.description:
Solve word problems involving collections of money, including dollar bills, quarters, dimes, nickels, and pennies.
Record the total using $ and ¢ appropriately. See Table 1.

EE79203673C1458B84ED12EBFBDE18B4.description: Tell time to the nearest 5 minutes using a digital clock.

6D26C9F96CF5463F9917D2EC0F8245F6.description: Tell and write time from analog and digital clocks to the nearest five minutes, using a.m. and p.m.

0DC3B8DB9CDE40E29DA29456C4A52BA9.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

42AC68C6A8044109A7225D8C95313BEC.description:
Represent whole numbers as lengths from 0 on a number line diagram with equally spaced points corresponding
to the numbers 0, 1, 2, …, and represent whole-number sums and differences within 100 on a number line
diagram.

0C982A5BA5C14643A0A1527C24F424E5.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

B481BCB88DA24460BCDC59914E7C2582.description:
Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve word problems involving lengths that are given in the same unit.
See Table 1.

88E411BBD90943538020925ED6BD825C.description:
Relate addition and
subtraction to length.

83ED6E04FF6D40E09E9DD9EA205EEE05.description:
Solve one step subtraction problems involving the difference of the lengths of 2 objects in
standard length units.

B154E6A1E3024501A7ED9F5B6FAA73BB.description: Solve word problems involving the difference in standard length units.

72CD4CDF5C194867BA8E69F863B2A63A.description:
Measure to determine how much longer one object is than another, expressing the length difference in terms of
a standard length unit.

F3CB398F3DE6447C846670DA7848A9D8.description: Estimate the length of an object using units of feet and inches

E7B92F6154F746569F7FE7289AA9A50F.description: Recognize that standard measurement units can be decomposed into smaller units.

FFC046155355463893D25C17B5910936.description: Estimate lengths using units of inches, feet, centimeters, and meters.

1788DD2B6E564B1890DEDC2316DF85B6.description: Measure the attributes (length, width, height) of an object using 2 different size units.

D187E61C447D469782EF8493237ECEA3.description:
Measure the length of an object twice, using different standard length units for the two measurements; describe
how the two measurements relate to the size of the unit chosen. Understand that depending on the size of the
unit, the number of units for the same length varies.

0296508FAF8E45739D2F1C2C4968FE2C.description: Select appropriate tools and demonstrate or identify appropriate measuring techniques.

CD0A1636A0224C2BAED582486470AE9A.description:
Select appropriate tool and unit of measurement to measure an object(ruler or yard stick;
inches or feet).

BCB7CF156C29496F9B6A1D52622F5A73.description:
Measure the length of an object by selecting and using appropriate tools (e.g., ruler, meter stick, yardstick,
measuring tape).

C7DD2D4FC20041B48BF963E94877EBF8.description:
Measure and estimate
lengths in standard units.

4A316F2AF5C44B37BCAD4382658E23DD.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

3E1B9CAFEE4849C092543EF81880ECE1.description:
Explain why addition and subtraction strategies work, using place value and the properties of operations.
(Explanations may be supported by drawings or objects.)

D2E31EC9FF4C4607AF0B24EF24E79AB3.description:
Mentally add or subtract 100 from a given set from the 100s family (e.g., what is 100 more
than 500? What is 100 less than 700?).

2A9AA2D644774AC48CDBF40331C57364.description:
Mentally add or subtract 100 from a given set from the 100s family (e.g., what is 100 more
than 500? What is 100 less than 700?).

8CD52D50419949E892C6DD98930D9D61.description:
Mentally add or subtract 10 from a given set from the 10s family (e.g., what is 10 more than
50? What is 10 less than 70?).

0E520FE66C804B16B7C76B1074808C46.description:
Mentally add 10 or 100 to a given number in the range of 100 and 900, and mentally subtract 10 or 100 from a
given number in the range of 100 and 900.

E9989B6A687C42548B646FBD916DA0CD.description: Use diagrams and number lines to solve addition or subtraction problems.

686091452A0E4BA2B60566031A1CE8C1.description: Decompose tens into ones and/or hundreds into tens in subtraction situations.

5A8AC59F7E8E4D299178AF1FBFADDF95.description: Decompose tens into ones and/or hundreds into tens in subtraction situations.

D0568055977B4BA8BE3DC0E26C86E966.description:
Demonstrate understanding of addition and subtraction within 1000, connecting objects or drawings to strategies
based on place value (including multiples of 10), properties of operations, and/or the relationship between
addition and subtraction. Relate the strategy to a written form. See Table 1.

39FB548864064A97AECE65A7FC8664F1.description: Combine up to 3 sets of 20 or less.

0981CE03F4BB449D9B964863E2AEDCE5.description: Add up to three two-digit numbers using strategies based on place value and properties of operations.

780F724CD58044B487F9A282A7D11E21.description: Model addition and subtraction with base 10 blocks within 100.

98B3785809904AA3A5BBF80118E4422D.description: Model addition and subtraction with base 10 blocks within 50.

D6ED399C45F84E2AAA81881EE253F6C0.description: Model addition and subtraction with base 10 blocks within 20.

3C805593F4A04AD5927761A2B690EBBF.description:
Fluently add and subtract within 100 using strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the
relationship between addition and subtraction.

AC84B6702B3942829F815615425DF799.description:
Use place value
understanding and
properties of operations to
add and subtract.

F8DCC30757BC42109970BA932FECB80E.description:
Compare 3 digit numbers using representations and numbers (e.g., identify more
hundreds, less hundreds, more tens, less tens, more ones, less ones, larger number,
smaller number).

4CDF348531634185B57F57BBFDED1883.description:
Compare 3 digit numbers using representations and numbers (e.g., identify more
hundreds, less hundreds, more tens, less tens, more ones, less ones, larger number,
smaller number).

8C778AF2D25E48849A576942299F4129.description:
Compare 2 digit numbers using representations and numbers (e.g., identify more tens,
less tens, more ones, less ones, larger number, smaller number).

4C1AE280F7304A6DA546D96A20DDECBC.description: Compare (greater than, less than, equal to) 2 numbers up to 100.

436E8B17D04F4BCAB8CD4893CE235225.description:
Compare two three-digit numbers based on meanings of the hundreds, tens, and ones digits, using >, =, and <
symbols to record the results of comparisons.

6A3115AD92654489AE10F19974556AF5.description: Write or select the expanded form for up to 3 digit number.

FD0DA76564B24F93BF92B883C83E87A2.description: Explain what the zero represents in place value (hundreds, tens, ones) in a number.

EDB2EAE401454D8491015D2DDF7D8F44.description: Write or select expanded form for any 3 digit number.

CA78B79BEDF044868B7E6CFC723A9D18.description: Write or select expanded form for any 2 digit number.

FDB8F1360C424BC4A4DE2F49E1ADBF40.description: Identify the numeral between 0 and 100 when presented the name.

782B02F3DAAC401FBCB585F149AF66C7.description: Read and write numbers up to 1000 using base-ten numerals, number names, and expanded form.

C9CD1E76B9254392B33C7C46AF0D8027.description:
Solve real world problems by using mental math (such as skip counting by 2s within 20,
5s within 50, and 10s within 100).

990C68CC993541F78CCB0956F68ABF23.description: Count within 1000; skip count by 5's, 10's and 100's.

512FB1536F2C4428B35FDD5165D0D72B.description: Build representations of 3 digit numbers using hundreds, tens, and ones.

DBA6953515AD4BA5BA33D4303046303D.description: Build representations of 3 digit numbers using tens and ones.

D2EDD3E4F1DA41C095EE3C4242D0AB72.description:
Understand that the three digits of a three-digit number represent groups of hundreds, tens, and ones (e.g., 706
equals 7 hundreds, 0 tens, and 6 ones and also equals 70 tens and 6 ones).
Understand the following as special cases:
a. 100 can be thought of as a group of ten tens—called a “hundred.”
b. The numbers 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, 900 refer to one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight,
or nine hundreds (and 0 tens and 0 ones).

EC3375067C88431293C9F6661FC10C15.description: Number and Operations in Base Ten

D898A9639CCB4560AADEA601C8945021.description:
Find total number inside an array with neither number in the columns or rows larger than
5.

F61595B7D5824294843E42AAE157B066.description:
Find the total number of objects when given the number of identical groups and the
number of objects in each group neither number larger than 5.

0EF2E57CA7C743FBA82F9CB088311FEF.description:
Use addition to find the total number of objects arranged in rectangular arrays (with up to 5 rows and 5 columns).
Write an equation to express the total as a sum of equal addends.

EC6706750BFD4AF2B8230E0BB78395D9.description: Identify numbers as odd or even.

3C9DB588815443299B4C743FE1973789.description:
Determine whether a group of objects (up to 20) has an odd or even number of members (e.g., by pairing objects
or counting them by 2's).

545417812D4E409FA3E3312407DAC880.description:
Work with equal groups of
objects to gain foundations
for multiplication.

16E2F8848619425DB899A0E6243A4AAC.description: Identify the rule of arithmetic patterns that are increasing.

858A9B3CC55A4FA9A712C3116D2C82F5.description:
Fluently add and subtract within 20. By the end of Grade 2, know from memory all sums of two one-digit
numbers.

7EBE793D7776405DAE807E9D49751C7B.description: Write or select an equation representing the problem and its solution.

26C8DCCC74AB4617BEE7D7FA98415138.description: Use pictures, drawings or objects represent the steps of a problem.

D5F72CC4524F4D0385630EE565239B35.description:
Solve one or two step addition and subtraction problems, and add and subtract within
100, using objects, drawings, pictures.

C8C40F054AE04CAE973877242CD07269.description: Represent addition of 2 sets when shown the + symbol

55BE60E00E0246B5B64054BB079354AD.description:
Use addition and subtraction within 100 to solve one- and two-step word problems. Represent a word problem
as an equation with a symbol for the unknown. See Table 1.

38A76389B4FA4C33B23BCC4B4210FF26.description:
Represent and solve
problems involving addition
and subtraction.
